body_html:
This op would not be terribly hard to implement via XLA (although perhaps not performantly on CPU).

There's already a bilinear resize op (although I suspect it isn't fast on CPU) and one possible implementation strategy is to use almost the same code but with a different convolution kernel. This would at least fix the immediate error here, but I have no idea if it would meet any performance requirements.

Or if the resize here is an integer-multiple resize, then there are some special case implementations that would be easy to add.

body:
This op would not be terribly hard to implement via XLA (although perhaps not performantly on CPU).

There's already a bilinear resize op (although I suspect it isn't fast on CPU) and one possible implementation strategy is to use almost the same code but with a different convolution kernel. This would at least fix the immediate error here, but I have no idea if it would meet any performance requirements.

Or if the resize here is an integer-multiple resize, then there are some special case implementations that would be easy to add.
